item.name: CloudStack direct attached public IP alert
CloudStack System VM storage issue alert
CloudStack virtual network public IP alert

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(Console proxy creation failure)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Console Proxy VM Creation Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_migrate_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_migrate_alert.str(Unable to migrate vm)}=1
trigger.name: CloudStack Console Proxy VM Migrate Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(Unable to restart)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Console Proxy VM Restart Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(Console proxy startup failure)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Console Proxy VM Startup Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and ({Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(stopped unexpectedly)}=1 or {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(Console proxy down in zone)}=1)
trigger.name: Cloudstack Console Proxy VM Stop Unexpectedly

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.system_vm_storage_issue_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.system_vm_storage_issue_alert.str(Console proxy storage issue)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Console Proxy VM Storage Issue

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.update_resource_count_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.update_resource_count_alert.str(Failed to decrement resource count)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Decrement Resource Count Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.str(failed while starting virtual router)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Domain Router(VR) Startup Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_migrate_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_migrate_alert.str(Unable to migrate vm)}=1
trigger.name: CloudStack Domain Router(VR) VM Migrate Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.str(stopped unexpectedly)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Domain Router(VR) VM Stop Unexpectedly

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.str(Unable to restart)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Domain Router VM Restart Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.console_proxy_state_alert.str(Failed to open console proxy firewall port)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Fail To Open Console Proxy Firewall Port on VM

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(Failed to open secondary storage vm firewall port)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Fail To Open Secondary Storage Firewall Port on VM

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_cpu_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_cpu_alert.str(CPU)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Percentage Available CPU

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_memory_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_memory_alert.str(Memory)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Percentage Available Memory

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_secondary_storage_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_secondary_storage_alert.str(Available Secondary Storage)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Percentage Available Secondary Storage

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_storage_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.available_storage_alert.str(Available Storage)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Percentage Available Storage

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.remaining.storage_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.remaining.storage_alert.str(Remaining unallocated Storage)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Remaining Storage

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.private_ip_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.private_ip_alert.str(unallocated private IPs)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Unallocated Private IPs

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.direct_attached_public_ip_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.direct_attached_public_ip_alert.str(unallocated shared network IPs)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Unallocated Shared Network IPs
trigger.description: The same as Direct Attach Public IP low

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.virtual_network_public_ip_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.virtual_network_public_ip_alert.str(unallocated virtual network public)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Unallocated Virtual Public IPs

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.vlan_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.vlan_alert.str(unallocated VLANs)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Low Unallocated Vlan

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.managment_node_status.str(is down)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Management Service Stop by Admin

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.domain_router_state_alert.str(Monitoring Service on VR,{$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Monitor Service Alert On VR

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_server_status.nodata({$CS_TRAP_ALERT_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_server_status.str(No usage server)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack No usage server process running

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(Secondary Storage Vm creation failure)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Secondary Storage VM Creation Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(Unable to restart)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Secondary Storage VM Restart Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(Secondary Storage Vm startup failure)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Secondary Storage VM Startup Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and ({Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(stopped unexpectedly,{$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=1 or {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.ssvm_stop_alert.str(Secondary Storage Vm is down,{$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=1)
trigger.name: Cloudstack Secondary Storage VM Stop Unexpectedly

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.system_vm_storage_issue_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.system_vm_storage_issue_alert.str(Secondary Storage Vm storage issue)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Secondary Storage VM Storage Issue

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.update_resource_count_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.update_resource_count_alert.str(Maximum number of resources of type)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Snapshot Resource Limit Exceeded

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.vm_sync_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.vm_sync_state_alert.str(host is unreachable for too long)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Stalled VM On Disconnected Hosts

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.resource_limit_exceeded_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.resource_limit_exceeded_alert.str(Maximum number of resources of type)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Template or Volume Resource Limit Exceeded

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_sanity_result_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_sanity_result_alert.str(Usage Sanity Check failed)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack Usage Sanity Check Failed

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_server_result_alert.str(Usage job failed)}=1 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.usage_server_result_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0
trigger.name: Cloudstack Usage Server Job Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.str(Failed to deploy Vm with)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack User VM Creation Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_migrate_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_migrate_alert.str(Unable to migrate vm)}=1
trigger.name: CloudStack User VM Migrate Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.str(Unable to restart)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack User VM Restart Fail

trigger.expression: {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.nodata({$CS_CAPACITY_CHECK_INT})}=0 and {Template CloudStack Management:cs_cluster.user_vm_state_alert.str(stopped unexpectedly)}=1
trigger.name: Cloudstack User VM Stop Unexpectedly
